snippet: The classes, offered in partnership with the California company Coursera, will include weekly sessions in which students will meet in person.
abstract: Coursera, California-based venture that has enrolled five million students in its free online courses, announces partnership with United States government to create 'learning hubs' around the world where students can go to get Internet access to free courses supplemented by weekly in-person class discussions with local teachers or facilitators.
lead_paragraph: The classes, offered in partnership with the California company Coursera, will include weekly sessions in which students will meet in person.

headline.main: U.S. Teams Up With Operator of Online Courses to Plan a Global Network
headline.print_headline: U.S. Teams Up With Operator of Online Courses to Plan a Global Network
